snippet: According to one estimate, more than one in five owners of hybrid and electric vehicles are switching to S.U.V.s instead.
abstract: Sales of hybrid and electric cars are in decline, and owners are increasingly trading vehicles in, as low gasoline prices reduce incentive; estimates show that some 55 percent of such owners are defecting to gasoline-only models at trade-in time, and that one in five is opting to purchase an SUV; experts say that it may take prolonged spike in oil prices before demand returns.
lead_paragraph: According to one estimate, more than one in five owners of hybrid and electric vehicles are switching to S.U.V.s instead.

headline.main: With Gas Prices Less of a Worry, Buyers Pass Hybrid Cars By

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
